title: Strictly Come Dancing 2019 Movie Week results live: Anneka Rice eliminated after dance-off defeat to David James
text:
Anneka Rice and pro partner Kevin Clifton become second couple eliminated from Strictly 2019

David James survived his second consecutive dance-off

Bruno Tonioli interview: 'I don't really know who any of the Strictly celebrities are'

Under the glitterball with Michelle Visage: 'Look what happened in the US presidency. You gotta vote!'

Sign up to our weekly Ballroom Bulletin newsletter

And action! The Movie Week extravaganza took in blockbuster hits and box office flops.

Here are all the talking points and social media reaction from Sunday night's results show…

Anneka Rice was gracious loser but deserved to go

Many viewers would have been saddened to see Eighties TV favourite Anneka Rice bow out so early but let’s face it, she deserved to depart the dancefloor for that lumpen, leaden-footed routine. As judge Bruno Tonioli declared, it “wasn’t so much Kill Bill as Slaughter The Charleston”.

Poor Anneka struggled with timing, bounce, the crucial swivel and those martial arts props, looking as wooden as the kendo stick she was wielding. Indeed, it was often hard to tell which dance she was performing as she jogged and plodded around the ballroom floor. She promptly scored 11 points, her lowest yet, and such a low total sealed her fate.

Anneka took all the panel’s criticism with a gracious smile and was winningly self-deprecating, jokingly comparing herself to “the Ann Widdecombe figure” She came into the contest admitting she wasn’t sure if she had any dancing ability because she’d never really tried and that her yoga teacher calls her “Stiff Annie”.

Her flat-footed cha-cha in week one was almost as bad as her Charleston but it was the dance in between which was Anneka’s high point: a smooth, simple waltz full of sweet storytelling and elegant glide. Anneka looked much more comfortable in hold, so it’s a shame we won’t get to see her do ballroom again.

Still, at least she won’t have to face her aversion to frocks any more and can get back into comfy trousers.
